meanings.definition: To make or become Italian in character, culture, or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to italianise her cooking by using more olive oil and fresh herbs.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant decided to italianise their menu by adding traditional pasta dishes.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to italianise his wardrobe by wearing a lot of red, green, and white.
meanings.sent4: The small town square was italianised with colorful flags and banners during the festival.
meanings.sent5: The artist italianised the mural by incorporating iconic Italian landmarks and symbols.

meanings.definition: To adopt Italian customs or habits.
meanings.sent1: After visiting Italy, she wanted to italianise her daily routine by having espresso after every meal.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to italianise their holiday traditions by making homemade pasta on Christmas Eve.
meanings.sent3: He tried to italianise his greeting by kissing both cheeks of everyone he met.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood started to italianise with the opening of an authentic Italian gelato shop.
meanings.sent5: She hoped to italianise her language skills by practicing Italian phrases every day.
